tests.title: MCR-678-001: Validate Reason Code - Stolen (Vehicle with no active alerts)
tests.custom_preconds: Valid vehicle registration number with no alerts

custom_steps_separated.content:
Go to front office menu

Enter a valid vehicle registration number with no alerts
custom_steps_separated.expected: Redirected to the vehicle details screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
Click on the ‘Motor Tax’ tab

Select the current valid tax disc with more than three months remaining
custom_steps_separated.expected: See the full details of the motor tax disc

custom_steps_separated.content: Click on the “Cancel Tax” button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Redirected to the “Cancel Tax” screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
Set the “Refund Due?” radio button

Select the “Vehicle Stolen” Cancel Reason code

Provide the Cancellation Start Date
custom_steps_separated.expected: Confirm that the refund amount is calculated pro rata, based on the number of months remaining on the tax disc

custom_steps_separated.content: Click on “Continue” to confirm the cancel motor tax transaction
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Error message “Cannot select this reason code - no active stolen alert exists for the vehicle” is displayed at the top of the screen 

Cancel Reason field is highlighted in red

tests.title: MCR-678-006: Validate Reason Code - ELV Date (Cancellation Start Date that pre-dates the ELV Issued Date)
tests.custom_preconds: vehicle registration number with status that is "END-OF-LIFE VEHICLE"

custom_steps_separated.content:
Go to front office menu

Enter a valid vehicle registration number with status that is "END-OF-LIFE VEHICLE"
custom_steps_separated.expected: Redirected to the vehicle details screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
Click on the ‘Motor Tax’ tab

Select the current valid tax disc with more than three months remaining
custom_steps_separated.expected: See the full details of the motor tax disc

custom_steps_separated.content: Click on the “Cancel Tax” button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Redirected to the “Cancel Tax” screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
Set the “Refund Due?” radio button

Select the “Vehicle ELV” Cancel Reason code

Provide Cancellation Start Date that pre-dates the ELV Issued Date for the vehicle
custom_steps_separated.expected: Confirm that the refund amount is calculated pro rata, based on the number of months remaining on the tax disc

custom_steps_separated.content: Click on “Continue” to confirm the cancel motor tax transaction
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Error message “Cancellation Start Date cannot pre-date ELV Date for the vehicle” is displayed at the top of the screen

Cancel Reason field is highlighted in red

tests.title: MCR-678-008: Validate Reason Code - Stolen (Vehicle with a stolen alert)
tests.custom_preconds: Valid vehicle registration number with an active stolen alert

custom_steps_separated.content:
Go to front office menu

Enter a valid vehicle registration number with an active stolen alert
custom_steps_separated.expected: Redirected to the vehicle details screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
Click on the ‘Motor Tax’ tab

Select the current valid tax disc with more than three months remaining
custom_steps_separated.expected: See the full details of the motor tax disc

custom_steps_separated.content: Click on the “Cancel Tax” button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Redirected to the “Cancel Tax” screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
Set the “Refund Due?” radio button

Select the “Vehicle Stolen” Cancel Reason code

Provide the Cancellation Start Date
custom_steps_separated.expected: Confirm that the refund amount is calculated pro rata, based on the number of months remaining on the tax disc

custom_steps_separated.content: Click on “Continue” to confirm the cancel motor tax transaction
custom_steps_separated.expected:
No error is displayed

The system allows the transaction to proceed to the confirmation screen

tests.title: MCR-550-001: Search for a garage - Exact match found
tests.custom_preconds:
Logged in as internal user (cashier or supervisor).

Garage code is known and exists.
tests.custom_steps:
Navigate to front office menu.

Enter a valid Garage Code.

Click Search.
tests.custom_expected:
Backend is queried.

User is redirected to the garage details screen (handled in MCR-266).

tests.title: MCR-550-002: Search for a garage - Exact match not found
tests.custom_preconds:
Logged in as internal user.

Invalid/non-existing Garage Code is used.
tests.custom_steps:
Navigate to front office menu.

Enter invalid Garage Code.

Click Search.
tests.custom_expected:
A pop-up appears: “Garage Code details not found”.

User clicks OK, and remains on the search screen.

tests.title: MCR-550-003: Search with empty Garage Code
tests.custom_preconds: User is on the Front Office screen.
tests.custom_steps:
Leave the Garage Code field blank.

Click on Search.
tests.custom_expected: The system displays an inline validation or pop-up: Garage Code is a mandatory field.

tests.title: MCR-550-004: Search with invalid format (e.g. special characters)
tests.custom_preconds: User is on the Front Office screen.
tests.custom_steps:
Enter a Garage Code with invalid characters (e.g. @#$%).

Click on Search.
tests.custom_expected: The system displays: Garage Code details not found.

tests.title: MCR-550-005: Search with different case (case sensitivity validation)
tests.custom_preconds: Garage code exists in uppercase (e.g. ABC123).
tests.custom_steps:
Enter the garage code in lowercase (e.g. abc123).

Click on Search.
tests.custom_expected: Irrelevant - numeric only field

tests.title: MCR-550-006: Search with leading/trailing spaces
tests.custom_preconds: User is on the Front Office screen.
tests.custom_steps:
Enter a valid Garage Code but with leading or trailing spaces (e.g. 10 256).

Click on Search.
tests.custom_expected:
The system trims spaces.

If code is valid, correct garage details are returned.

tests.title: MCR-550-007: Repeated search attempts (Invalid followed by valid)
tests.custom_preconds: User is on the Front Office screen, logged in as an internal user (cashier or supervisor).
tests.custom_steps:
Enter a Garage Code that does not exist in the database.

Click on the Search button.

Acknowledge the error by clicking the OK button on the Garage Code details not found modal.

Immediately enter a valid Garage Code that exists in the database.

Click on the Search button.
tests.custom_expected:
The system successfully finds the garage.

The system displays the garage details (or proceeds to the View Garage Details screen as handled by MCR-266).

tests.title: MCR-26-001: Successful search - Multiple garages found
tests.custom_preconds: User is logged in as an internal user (cashier or supervisor) and is on the Advanced Garage Search screen.
tests.custom_steps:
Enter two or more valid search criteria (e.g. Garage Name and County).

Click on Search.
tests.custom_expected:
The system displays a list of garages that match the search criteria.

User is redirected to the garage list screen (MCR-27).

tests.title: MCR-26-002: Successful search - Single garage found
tests.custom_preconds: User is on the Advanced Garage Search screen.
tests.custom_steps:
Enter two or more valid search criteria.

Click on Search where exactly one garage matches.
tests.custom_expected: User is redirected to the garage details screen (MCR-266).

tests.title: MCR-26-003: Search - No garages found
tests.custom_preconds: User is on the Advanced Garage Search screen.
tests.custom_steps:
Enter two or more search criteria that match no garage.

Click on Search.
tests.custom_expected:
A message is displayed at the top of the screen:
"Garage details not found".

User can click OK to acknowledge the message.

tests.title: MCR-26-004: Validation - Less than two search criteria provided
tests.custom_preconds: User is on the Advanced Garage Search screen.
tests.custom_steps:
Enter fewer than two search criteria.

Click on Search.
tests.custom_expected:
The system displays a message:
"Please provide two or more search criteria".

tests.title: MCR-26-005: Validation - Non-alphanumeric characters entered
tests.custom_preconds: User is on the Advanced Garage Search screen.
tests.custom_steps:
Enter non-alphanumeric characters (e.g. @, #, &) in any search field.

Click on Search.
tests.custom_expected:
A message is displayed at the top of the screen:
"Alphanumeric characters only".

The offending field is highlighted in red.

tests.title: MCR-26-006: Clear search criteria
tests.custom_preconds: User has entered search criteria on the Advanced Garage Search screen.
tests.custom_steps: Click the Clear button.
tests.custom_expected:
All fields are cleared.

User can begin entering new search criteria.

tests.title: MCR-26-007: Wildcard search implied without needing asterisk
tests.custom_preconds: User is on the Advanced Garage Search screen.
tests.custom_steps:
Enter part of a Garage Name (e.g. Auto).

Click on Search.
tests.custom_expected: The system returns results that contain that partial match (e.g. Autohub, AutoFix).

tests.title: MCR-26-008: Search with one-character criteria
tests.custom_preconds:
User is on the Advanced Garage Search screen.

There are no minimum length restrictions associated with the search criteria - the user can choose to enter as little as one character should they wish. Obviously, the more characters they enter the better for their search, but the screen will not need to enforce minimum lengths.
tests.custom_steps:
Enter two search criteria where at least one is a single character (e.g. Garage Name = A, County = Dublin).

Click on Search
tests.custom_expected:
The system processes the search.

Displays appropriate results that match the criteria.

**requires User story MCR-27: Find a garage - Display garage search results

tests.title: MCR-27-001: Display garage search results - basic list
tests.custom_preconds:
User is logged in as internal staff (cashier or supervisor).

Advanced Garage Search screen is accessible.
tests.custom_steps:
Navigate to the front office menu.

Click on the Advanced Garage Search link.

Enter valid search criteria.

Click Search.
tests.custom_expected:
The user is redirected to the garage list screen.

A list of garages that satisfy the search criteria is displayed.

Columns Garage Code, Garage Name, Town, County, Trade Status, and VAT Number are populated.

tests.title: MCR-27-002: Display garage search results - pagination
tests.custom_preconds: Search returns more than 10 garages
tests.custom_steps:
Perform a garage search that yields over 10 results.

View the first page of results.

Use Next and Previous buttons to navigate.

Optionally jump to the start, middle, or end page.
tests.custom_expected:
10 garages are displayed per page.

Navigation works as expected via pagination controls.

tests.title: MCR-27-003: Display garage search results - breadcrumbs
tests.custom_preconds: Search results are displayed.
tests.custom_steps: From the garage list screen, click the breadcrumb link to return to the Advanced Garage Search screen.
tests.custom_expected:
User is redirected to the Advanced Garage Search screen.

Previously entered search criteria are still populated.

tests.title: MCR-27-004: Display garage search results - click Garage Code
tests.custom_preconds: Search results are displayed.
tests.custom_steps: On the garage list screen, click a Garage Code link.
tests.custom_expected: User is redirected to the View Garage Details screen (MCR-28).

tests.title: MCR-27-005: Display garage search results - click View hyperlink
tests.custom_preconds: Search results are displayed.
tests.custom_steps: On the garage list screen, click the View hyperlink next to a garage
tests.custom_expected: User is redirected to the View Garage Details screen (MCR-28).

tests.title: MCR-27-006: Display garage search results - tooltip for truncated text
tests.custom_preconds: Search results contain a field where data exceeds display width.
tests.custom_steps: Hover over the truncated field (shows “…”) in the results table.
tests.custom_expected: The full content of the field is displayed in a tooltip.

tests.title: MCR-266-001: View garage details successfully
tests.custom_preconds: User is logged in as an internal user (cashier or supervisor)
tests.custom_steps:
Go to Front Office menu

On Garage menu option

Enter valid search criteria (a garage code)

Click Search
tests.custom_expected:
System redirects to the Garage Page screen

Garage Code, Garage Name, and Company Registration Number are displayed at the top

All garage details are populated correctly

custom_steps_separated.content:
Go to Front Office menu

On Garage menu option

Enter valid search criteria (a garage code)

Click Search
custom_steps_separated.expected:
System redirects to the Garage Page screen

Garage Code, Garage Name, and Company Registration Number are displayed at the top

All garage details are populated correctly

custom_steps_separated.content:
Go to Front Office menu

Click 'Advanced Garage Search'

Enter valid search criteria to return a list of garages

Click 'View' link on one of the records
custom_steps_separated.expected:
System redirects to the Garage Page screen

Garage Code, Garage Name, and Company Registration Number are displayed at the top

All garage details are populated correctly

tests.title: MCR-266-002: Navigate back from the View Garage Details screen
tests.custom_preconds: User is on the View Garage Details screen
tests.custom_steps: Click the Back button
tests.custom_expected: User is redirected to the previous screen (garage list or search screen)

custom_steps_separated.content:
Go to Front Office menu

On Garage menu option

Enter valid search criteria (a garage code)

Click Search
custom_steps_separated.expected: System directs to the Garage Page screen

custom_steps_separated.content: Click 'Back'
custom_steps_separated.expected: User is returned to Front Office menu page

custom_steps_separated.content:
Go to Front Office menu

Click 'Advanced Garage Search'

Enter valid search criteria to return a list of garages

Click 'View' link on one of the records
custom_steps_separated.expected: System directs to the Garage Page screen

custom_steps_separated.content: Click 'Back'
custom_steps_separated.expected:
User is returned to Garage List page

List is still populated with previous search results

tests.title: MCR-266-003: View garage details.  Bread Crumbs 1
tests.custom_steps: Click the Update button
tests.custom_expected: Garage details fields become editable

custom_steps_separated.content:
On the front office menu

Enter a valid garage code

click Search
custom_steps_separated.expected: Redirected to the view garage details screen

custom_steps_separated.content: Observe breadcrumbs
custom_steps_separated.expected: The bread crumbs showing “Front Office > Garage Details”

tests.title: MCR-266-004: View garage details.  Bread Crumbs 2
tests.custom_steps: Click the Save button
tests.custom_expected:
Changes are saved to the database

Confirmation message is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content:
Go to Front Office menu

Click 'Advanced Garage Search'

Enter valid search criteria to return a list of garages

Click 'View' link on one of the records
custom_steps_separated.expected: System redirects to the Garage Page screen

custom_steps_separated.content: Observe breadcrumbs
custom_steps_separated.expected:
I can see the bread crumbs showing 


“Front Office > Advanced Garage Search > Garage List > Garage Details”

custom_steps_separated.content: Navigate using each breadcrumb option
custom_steps_separated.expected: All breadcrumb links work as expected

tests.title: MCR-266-005: Garage headers always visible
tests.custom_steps: Click the Cancel button
tests.custom_expected:
System displays a confirmation message:
"You have made changes to the garage. Do you wish to save your changes?"

custom_steps_separated.content:
Go to Front Office menu

On Garage menu option

Enter valid search criteria (a garage code)

Click Search
custom_steps_separated.expected: System redirects to the Garage Page screen

custom_steps_separated.content: Click through each tab (Main Details, Vehicles, Trade Plates, Insurance, More)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
The Garage Code, Garage Name and Company Registration Number will be displayed at the top of the screen, under the “Garage Details” heading. 

These three fields will remain as the header at the top of all the garage-related screens.

tests.title: MCR-266-006: Display of New Trade Plate button
tests.custom_preconds: User is on the View Garage Details screen
tests.custom_steps: View the screen
tests.custom_expected:
The New Trade Plate button is displayed

It is enabled/disabled according to Trade Plate stock assignment (handled by related stories)

tests.title: MCR-266-007: Garage header always visible
MCR-842-001: Process Motor Tax - Tax disc expired - Tax Class can be updated
tests.custom_preconds: User is logged in as internal user (cashier or supervisor)
tests.custom_steps:
Select a vehicle where the current motor tax has expired

Navigate to the Process Motor Tax screen
tests.custom_expected:
Tax Class dropdown list is enabled

User can select a new Tax Class

User can select tax period (3, 6, 12 months)

Correct Start Date, End Date, and total to pay are displayed

User can click Continue to proceed

tests.title: MCR-842-002: Process Motor Tax - Tax disc not expired - Tax Class cannot be updated
tests.custom_preconds: User is logged in as internal user (cashier or supervisor)
tests.custom_steps:
Select a vehicle where the current motor tax is active (in month of expiry)

Navigate to the Process Motor Tax screen
tests.custom_expected:
Tax Class dropdown is disabled

Current Tax Class is displayed as read-only

Tooltip appears alongside Tax Class field

Hovering over the tooltip displays:
"Cannot update Tax Class as part of a renewal if current motor tax has not expired"

User can select tax period and click Continue

tests.title: MCR-842-003: Process Motor Tax - Tax disc expiry on current date
tests.custom_preconds: User is logged in as internal user (cashier or supervisor)
tests.custom_steps:
Select a vehicle where the motor tax expiry date is today

Navigate to the Process Motor Tax screen
tests.custom_expected:
Tax Class dropdown is enabled (expiry treated as occurred)

User can update the Tax Class

tests.title: MCR-842-004: Process Motor Tax - Validate tooltip display
tests.custom_preconds: User is on the Process Motor Tax screen for a vehicle with active tax
tests.custom_steps: Hover over the tooltip next to the Tax Class field
tests.custom_expected:
Tooltip message is visible:
"Cannot update Tax Class as part of a renewal if current motor tax has not expired"

tests.title: MCR-842-005: Process Motor Tax - Attempt Tax Class change via UI when disabled (UI security test)
tests.custom_preconds: User is on the Process Motor Tax screen for a vehicle with active tax
tests.custom_steps:
Use browser developer tools to force-enable the Tax Class dropdown

Attempt to change and submit
tests.custom_expected:
System prevents submission with changed Tax Class

Original Tax Class remains unchanged

tests.title: MCR-842-006: Process Motor Tax - Clear form and return
tests.custom_preconds: User is on the Process Motor Tax screen for a vehicle with active tax
tests.custom_steps:
Click Back or navigate away

Return to the Process Motor Tax screen
tests.custom_expected:
Tax Class field remains disabled

Tooltip still displays correct message
